com.percussion.services.contentmgr
Interface IPSContentMgr

All Superinterfaces:
IPSContentTypeMgr, NodeTypeManager, QueryManager
public interface IPSContentMgr
extends IPSContentTypeMgr, QueryManager

The content manager allows the loading of content items by either GUID or path. Guids and paths can reference either content items or children. You will need to construct special GUIDs to reference either. See PSLegacyGuid for more details.

Path syntax uses the title fields from folders and items. The path starts with a // for absolute paths. Relative paths start with no slash character. Paths ending in #nnn indicate a specific revision of a content item.

Examples:
//Sites/EnterpriseInvestments/Funds/Morningfund references the Morningfund document in the Funds directory.
//Sites/CorporateInvestments/Company/R-and-B#2 references revision 2 of the document R-and-B
//Sites/CorporateInvestments/Regions/NorthEast#3/Category#1 references the first Category child of revision 3 of the NorthEast document

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

findItemsByPath

List<Node> findItemsByPath(Session sess,
                           List<String> paths,
                           com.percussion.services.contentmgr.PSContentMgrConfig config)
                           throws PathNotFoundException,
                                  RepositoryException
Find the items named by the given paths. A path consists of a series of names, separated by the slash character. The path may start with a slash, in which case the root parameter is ignored and the search commences with the repository root folder (the repository of the root node).

To load a specific version of a node, append [v#] to the path, where # is a dot separated version string. Most of the time # will be a simple integer.

Depending on the options provided, the properties presented may or may not have output translations applied. See PSContentMgrOption and PSContentMgrConfig for details.

Parameters:
sess - the session object, must be null in Rhythmyx 6.x, which identifies the workspace and root node to traverse to find the items specified by the paths. If null then the entire repository tree is used for the lookup.
paths - the paths to the items, each element is found in turn by matching the name in the path.
config - the configuration, may be null
Returns:
the selected items, never null. The returned list can have fewer elements if one or more path was not found in the repository.
Throws:
PathNotFoundException - if one or more paths contain missing elements
RepositoryException - if there is a problem in the repository

findItemsByGUID

List<Node> findItemsByGUID(List<IPSGuid> guids,
                           com.percussion.services.contentmgr.PSContentMgrConfig config)
                           throws RepositoryException
Find the items named by the given GUIDs. The guid contains the repository index of the repository that has the given item. The passed guids reference a particular version of a particular item, so no added version information is needed.

Depending on the options provided, the properties presented may or may not have output translations applied. See PSContentMgrOption and PSContentMgrConfig for details.

Parameters:
guids - the guids for the items to be loaded, must never be null and may not contain null elements
config - the configuration, may be null
Returns:
the selected items, never null. The returned list can have fewer elements if one or more uuid was not found in any repository.
Throws:
RepositoryException - if there is a problem in the repository

findItemIdsByNodeDefinition

Collection<IPSGuid> findItemIdsByNodeDefinition(NodeDefinition def)
                                                throws RepositoryException
Find the items that are of the given type. If there are no items, then this returns an empty list.

Parameters:
def - the node definition to use in the search, never null
Returns:
the selected items ids, never null. The returned list may be empty. The returned list can be passed to the GUID find method to load the nodes.
Throws:
RepositoryException - if there is a problem in the repository

executeQuery

QueryResult executeQuery(Query query,
                         int maxresults,
                         Map<String,? extends Object> params)
                         throws InvalidQueryException,
                                RepositoryException
Deprecated. use executeQuery(Query, int, Map, String) instead.

Convenience method which calls executeQuery(Query, int, Map, String) with null passed as the value for locale.

Parameters:
query - the query to perform, never null
maxresults - the maximum results, or -1 for no limit
params - params to be passed to expand variables in the query, may be null
Returns:
a query result, never null
Throws:
InvalidQueryException - if the query is invalid for some reason. Reasons include, but are not limited to, referencing non-existent content types, and content item properties.
RepositoryException - if some other problem occurs during the query.

executeQuery

QueryResult executeQuery(Query query,
                         int maxresults,
                         Map<String,? extends Object> params,
                         String locale)
                         throws InvalidQueryException,
                                RepositoryException
Execute the given query against the repository. The query was prepared earlier using the query manager API. This is the method called when the query executes itself.

Parameters:
query - the query to perform, never null
maxresults - the maximum results, or -1 for no limit
params - params to be passed to expand variables in the query, may be null
locale - the locale, which is used to determine the colating sequence when ordering results, may be null or empty, in which case the current JVM locale is used.
Returns:
a query result, never null
Throws:
InvalidQueryException - if the query is invalid for some reason. Reasons include, but are not limited to, referencing non-existent content types, and content item properties.
RepositoryException - if some other problem occurs during the query.

filterItemsByNodeDefinitions

Collection<IPSGuid> filterItemsByNodeDefinitions(Set<IPSGuid> types,
                                                 Collection<IPSGuid> ids)
Filter the input set of content guids to those that are members of at least one of the passed content types

Parameters:
types - the input content types, never null
ids - the input guids, never null
Returns:
those items that match the content type list, never null but may be empty.

saveItems

void saveItems(List<Node> items,
               com.percussion.services.contentmgr.PSContentMgrConfig config)
               throws RepositoryException
Save one or more content items to the repository. Each item is in one of two states: either it is a fresh item that is to be persisted, in which case there should be no existing object of that id in the database (understanding that we share content status records for different versions of a single content item), or it is an existing object that will be merged to the existing object in the database.

It is an error to save a fresh item and find an existing backing object for the shared or local definition tables, and it is an error to save an existing object and not to find it's backing object in the database.

For the merge case, only unmodified properties are merged back to the existing object. For the new case, the node being persisted must have been created using createItem(NodeDefinition) or #createNewRevision(Node).

Depending on the options provided, the properties presented may or may not have input translations and validations applied. See PSContentMgrOption and PSContentMgrConfig for details.

Parameters:
items - the items to save, must not be null and must not be empty
config - the configuration that dictates what options are to be applied to the save process, never null
Throws:
RepositoryException - if one or more items fail a validation then a ConstraintViolationException is thrown, if there is an integrity problem with one or more items then one or more subclasses of this exception may be thrown. An underlying problem with the repository will throw a straight version of this exception that is chained to the original ORM problem.

createItem

Node createItem(NodeDefinition def)
Create a new content item of the given type. The returned content item's fields will be populated as appropriate using the information about the content editor held by the item definition manager. Initial values must be defined by JEXL scripts for this to take place. Calling this method with an "old" content type will work, but fields with initial values will not be populated.

Parameters:
def - the content type definition, never null.
Returns:
the new content item, not yet persisted to the database

createItemRevision

Node createItemRevision(Node existing)
Create a new revision of the existing content item. The new revision is a clone of the existing item, with the exception that the revision will be incremented by one. After this method, the tip revision in the status record will be incremented.

Parameters:
existing - the existing node, never null
Returns:
the new content item, not yet persisted to the database

copyItem

Node copyItem(Node existing)
Create a new copy of the existing content item. The new copy is a clone of the existing item, but is represented by a separate contentid. Properties and children are copied one for one from the existing item to the new item.

Parameters:
existing - the existing node, never null
Returns:
the new content item, not yet persisted to the database

deleteItems

void deleteItems(List<IPSGuid> items)
                 throws RepositoryException
Delete one or more items from the repository. For each item, any existing relationships are removed (whether the relationship is to the item as an owner or dependent), and the status records, shared records and local records are removed from the repository.

Before performing the deletion(s), the method first validates that all the items exist. If an item does not exist, no deletions are performed.

Parameters:
items - the guids referencing the items to be purged from the repository, never null or empty
Throws:
RepositoryException - if an item does not exist, or cannot be deleted due to a repository problem
